metadata.title: CVE-2022-38533 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In GNU Binutils before 2.40, there is a heap-buffer-overflow in the errorfunction bfd_getl32 when called from the strip_main function in strip-newvia a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-mips-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-mips64-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-mips64el-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-mipsel-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-multiarch - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-source - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm5').
